00001 # The BARD overlay
00002 
00003 ## System modules
00004 import sys, socket, threading, getopt
00005 ## Local modules
00006 import p_engine, rulesUpdate, rule_generator
00007 
00008 ## default values for globals
00009 host, port = "localhost", 9999
00010 p_ratio = 0.5
00011 max_atoms = 10000
00012 ## 10hr work week. 1 day, 2 days. 1 week = 168hrs. 1 month = 720hrs.
00013 frames = [10, 24, 48]#, 168, 720]
00014 ## The list of persistant atoms that await user decision and white filtering
00015 p_atoms = []
00016 ## Filenames
00017 white_file = "../lists/whitelist.txt"
00018 black_file = "../lists/blacklist_bard.rules"
00019 et_rules = "../lists/blacklist_et.rules"
00020 dump_path = "../dump"
00021 ## Locks
00022 list_lock = threading.Lock()
00023 white_lock = threading.Lock()
00024 
00025 
00026 ## Implements basic client functions for connecting to server
00027 # and recieving data in the form of a string
00028 class Client:
00029     ## The Client constructor
00030     def __init__(self, host, port):
00031         self.host = host
00032         self.port = port 
00033         self.conn = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM)
00034         
00035     ## Recieves data in the form of a string
00036     # @return data string
00037     def get_data(self):
00038         data = []
00039         while 1:
00040             d = self.conn.recv(1024)
00041             data.extend(d)
00042             if len(d) < 1024: break
00043         return "".join(data)
00044     
00045     ## Starts a connection to the server to see if it is up
00046     # @return errorcode 0 if everything is ok, 1 otherwise
00047     def connect_to_server(self):
00048         try:
00049             self.conn.connect((self.host, self.port))
00050             return 1
00051         except socket.error, e:
00052             print >>sys.stderr, "Can't connect to remote host", str(e)
00053             return 0
00054 
00055 
00056 ## Class that runs Pengine as a thread
00057 class PengineThread(threading.Thread):
00058 
00059     ## The constructor
00060     # @param pengine The class instance that will be running under 
00061     # this thread
00062     def __init__(self):
00063         threading.Thread.__init__(self)
00064         self.pengine = Pengine(frames, max_atoms, dump_path, p_ratio)
00065 
00066     ## Runs pengine indefinitely
00067     def run(self):
00068         while True:
00069             list_lock.aquire()
00070             p_atoms.append(self.pengine.run())
00071             list_lock.release()
00072 
00073     
00074 ## Performs updates to local files based on server response
00075 class FileUpdateThread(threading.Thread, Client):
00076     ## The constructor
00077     # @param host The host to connect to
00078     # @param port The port to connect to
00079     def __init__(self, host, port):
00080         threading.Thread.__init__(self)
00081         Client.__init__(self, host, port)
00082 
00083     ## Updates the local blacklist and whitelist files
00084     # @param serv_white The text version of the new file
00085     # @param serv_black The text version of the new file
00086     def update_files(self, serv_white, serv_black):
00087         white_lock.aquire()
00088         white_fp = file(white_file, 'w')
00089         black_fp = file(black_fp, 'w')
00090         
00091         print >white_fp, serv_white
00092         print >black_fp, serv_black
00093         white_fp.close()
00094         black_fp.close()
00095         white_lock.release()
00096         
00097     ## Runs the thread indefinitely
00098     # @return err The error code
00099     def run(self):
00100         if not self.connect_to_server():
00101             return 1
00102         err = 0
00103         while True:
00104             try:
00105                 self.conn.send('3') # Check for whitelist update
00106                 serv_white = self.get_data()
00107                 self.conn.send('4') # Check for blacklist update
00108                 serv_black = self.get_data()
00109             except socket.error, e:
00110                 print >>sys.stderr, "Got a socket error in update files thread: ", str(e)
00111                 err = 1
00112                 break
00113             except (EOFError, KeyboardInterrupt):
00114                 err = 1
00115                 break
00116             self.update_files(serv_white, serv_black)
00117             # Update ET rules
00118             rulesUpdate.update()
00119         self.conn.close()
00120         return err
00121 
00122                 
00123 ## Thread that handles user input, and updates the server with said input
00124 class UserInputServerPushThread(threading.Thread):
00125     ## The constructor
00126     # @param p_atoms The list of persistant atoms being stored by Bard at the moment
00127     def __init__(self, p_atoms):
00128         threading.Thread.__init__(self)
00129         self.p_atoms = p_atoms
00130         self.sid = 1000001
00131         self.rg = rule_generator.rule_generator("../lists", self.sid)
00132 
00133 
00134     ## Removes whitelisted atoms from the list of persistent atoms gotten from
00135     #  Pengine.
00136     def filterWhites(self):
00137         whiteLock.acquire()
00138         whiteList = open(white_file, "r")
00139         wll = []
00140         for line in whiteList:
00141             wll.append(self.stringToAtom(line))
00142         for index, atom in enumerate(self.p_atoms):
00143             for j in wll:
00144                 if(p_engine.CompareAtoms(i,j)):
00145                     self.p_atoms.pop(index)
00146                     break
00147         whiteLock.release()                    
00148 
00149     ## Converts a line from the white_file into an atom object
00150     #  @param line A line from the file that corresponds to a whitelisted atom
00151     #  @return The atom object created for comparison with new p_atoms
00152     def stringToAtom(self, line):
00153         temp = line.split(' ')
00154         a = p_engine.Atom(temp[0],temp[1],temp[2],-1)
00155         return a
00156 
00157     ## Prompts user for input on each atom for addition to white or black list
00158     def getDecisions(self):
00159         b_list = []
00160         w_list = []
00161         print("Assign each persistent atom to the blacklist (b) or whitelist (w) after each prompt")
00162         for index, atom in enumerate(self.p_atoms):
00163             i = raw_input("Atom: " + atom.dest_ip + ", " + atom.dest_port + ", " + atom.protocol)
00164             if(i == 'b'):
00165                 b_list.append(atom)
00166             elif(i == 'w'):
00167                 w_list.append(atom)
00168             p_atoms.pop(index)
00169             
00170     ## Updates the server's blacklist and whitelist
00171     # @return err The error code
00172     def updateServer(self):
00173         if not self.connect_to_server():
00174             return 1
00175         err = 0
00176         # Create snort rules
00177         b_list_rules = []
00178         for b_atom in self.b_list:
00179             b_list_rules.append(rg.block(b_atom))
00180         while True:
00181             try:                
00182                 self.conn.send('1') # Prompt to update whitelist
00183                 if self.get_data() != "whitelist":
00184                     err = 1
00185                     break
00186                 self.conn.send(str(self.b_list))
00187                 if self.get_data() != 'ok':
00188                     err = 1
00189                     break
00190                 self.conn.send('2') # Prompt to update blacklist
00191                 if self.get_data() != 'blacklist':
00192                     err = 1
00193                     break
00194                 self.conn.send(str(b_list_rules))
00195                 if self.get_data() != 'ok':
00196                     err = 1
00197                     break
00198                 break
00199             except socket.error, e:
00200                 print >>sys.stderr, "Got a socket error in updateServer thread: ", str(e)
00201                 err = 1
00202                 break
00203             except (EOFError, KeyboardInterrupt):
00204                 err = 1
00205                 break
00206         self.conn.close()
00207         return err
00208 
00209     ## Runs the thread indefinitely
00210     def run(self):
00211         while True:
00212             x = raw_input("Press Enter to label atoms")
00213             self.filterWhites()
00214             self.getDecisions()
00215             if self.updateServer() != 0:
00216                 return 1
00217 
00218                 
00219 ## The overarching Bard Class. Handles all operations from a threaded
00220 # standpoint.
00221 # Calls: p_engine for packet analysis
00222 # snort for packet sniffing and blocking
00223 # parser for snort output parsing
00224 # etc..
00225 class Bard(threading.Thread):
00226     ## Constructor initializes all components.
00227         # @param host The host ip to host the program
00228         # @param port The port to use for socket connections
00229     def __init__(self, host, port):
00230         threading.Thread.__init__(self)
00231         ## Host IP address
00232         self.host = host
00233                 ## Port for socket connection
00234         self.port = port
00235                 ## Socket connection
00236         self.conn = socket.socket(socket.AF_INET, socket.SOCK_STREAM)
00237         
00238     ## Begins by checking if the server is up
00239     def start(self):
00240         if not self.connect_to_server():
00241                 return
00242         # Update all components initially
00243         
00244         
00245         
00246 help_msg = """ Welcome to BARD. For help type --help.
00247 Window size is hardcoded to 1hr. Please set frame to be a number of windows.
00248 List of options:
00249 -p --port to specify a port number
00250 -h --host to specify a host ip
00251 -t --threshold to specify a threshold persistence ration (between 0 and 1)
00252 -f --frames to specify custom frame size. Must be comma delimited, no spaces. 
00253 """
00254 
00255 ## Usage() Exception is caught at the end of main(). 
00256 # Provides main with a single exit point for graceful error handling
00257 class Usage(BaseException):
00258     def __init__(self, msg):
00259         self.msg = msg
00260 
00261 ## The main method called on runtime
00262 def main(argv=None):
00263     global port, host, p_ratio, frames, help_msg
00264     if argv is None:
00265             argv = sys.argv
00266     try:
00267         try:
00268             opts, args = getopt.getopt(argv[1:], "p:h:t:f:", 
00269                                        ["help", "port", "host", "threshold",
00270                                         "frame"])
00271             for o, a in opts:
00272                 if o in ('-p', '--port'):
00273                     assert a > 0 and a <=65536, "Invalid Port"
00274                     port = a
00275                 if o in ('-h', '--host'):
00276                     # could place ip check here
00277                     host = a
00278                 if o in ('-t', '--threshold'):
00279                     assert a <= 1 and a > 0, "Invalid ratio, must be between 0 and 1"
00280                     p_ratio = a
00281                 if o in ('-f', '--frame'):
00282                     a_parsed = a.split(',')
00283                     for x in a_parsed:
00284                         assert type(int(x)) == int, "Incorrect format of frame, must be int"
00285                         frames.append(int(x))
00286                 if o == '--help':
00287                     print help_msg
00288                     return 0
00289         except AssertionError, msg:
00290             raise Usage(msg)
00291     except Usage, msg:
00292         print msg
00293         return 1
00294     
00295     # Start Program 
00296     x = Bard(host, port)
00297     x.start()
00298     # End Program
00299     print "Thank you for using BARD!"
00300     return 0
00301 
00302     
00303 if __name__ == "__main__":
00304     sys.exit(main())
